intro: Schwartzia tarrazuensis, commonly known as the Tarrazú yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, adding to its ornamental value. Schwartzia tarrazuensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
